Updates for 25 July 2016:
Updates to EPUB transform to support font embedding and obfuscation
Various fixes to the HTML5 transform
Small fixes to various DITA Community plugins

The DITA for Publishers project is an open-source, community project to enable the quick and productive use of DITA by Publishers. Enabling activities include:
Providing generic DITA specializations for common publishing document components, including publishing-specific map types and domains ("pubmap", publication map domain, publication metadata domain), topic types ("article", "chapter", "subsection", "sidebar", "part"), and domains ("formatting domain", "classification domain", "media (video and audio)", etc.).
General-purpose Open Toolkit plugins for generating EPUB and Kindle electronic books from any DITA map, as well as an HTML5 generation plugin.
Providing DITA Open Toolkit plugins with HTML, PDF, EPUB, and Kindle rendering support for the D4P specializations.
Providing tutorial and how-to guidance to Publishing users of DITA.
Providing a transformation framework and Open Toolkit plugin for converting styled Word documents to DITA.
Providing a transformation framework and Open Toolkit plugin for generating InCopy and InDesign documents from DITA content.
Host additional DITA-related tools specific to or of significant value to publishers when those tools need a home.
Provide an open forum for gathering Publishing-specific requirements for the DITA standard and its supporting tools.
See the DITA for Publishers User Guide for detailed information on how to use the DITA for Publishers components. (Experimental HTML5 version available at ../d4p-user-guide-html5/index.html.)

Eliot Kimber's DITA specialization and configuration tutorials can be found at http://www.xiruss.org/tutorials/dita-specialization/. Project Quick Reference

dita4publishers user documentation How To Use the DITA For Publishers Materials
DITA for Publishers User Guide (D4P HTML2 transform)
The D4P package also includes an EPUB and Kindle version of the User Guide.
Report bugs and request features https://github.com/dita4publishers/dita4publishers/issues
For issues against a specific plugin, use the issue tracker for that plugin. All plugins are either in the DITA for Publishers or DITA Community organizations on GitHub.
